intro: Maerua madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar thornbush, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
